newsitem.title: POLAND: Poland's Bank Pekao SA Q1 net rises to PLN 101 mln.
newsitem.headline: Poland's Bank Pekao SA Q1 net rises to PLN 101 mln.

text.p: The net profit of Poland's Bank Pekao SA rose in the first quarter of this year to 100.8 million zlotys from 80 million zlotys in the same period of last year, the bank's president said on Tuesday.
"The net profit in the first quarter of 1997 was 100.8 million zlotys, 25 percent more than in the first quarter of last year," Andrzej Dorosz told a news conference.
Dorosz said the results did not include Pekao's foreign units. He said the first quarter pre-tax profit rose 21 percent to 162.5 million zlotys.
In the whole of 1996 the bank earned net 247.5 million zlotys and had a pre-tax profit of 425.6 million zlotys.

The Warsaw-based state-owned bank which late last year took over three other state-owned banks to form a group slated for privatisation next year, is due to present its first consolidated earnings report in the second half of the year.
